channel.title: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming
channel.description:
At an nVidia event in Montreal, Canada on Oct. 17-18, nVidia introduced a new technology called G-Sync designed to revolutionize gaming by addressing gaming lag, stuttering and screen tearing.
[url='https://www.anandtech.com/show/7436/nvidias-gsync-attempting-to-revolutionize-gaming-via-smoothness']https://www.anandtech.com/show/7436/nvidias-gsync-attempting-to-revolutionize-gaming-via-smoothness[/url]
I believe this is what Mark Rein from Epic Games was referring to in his comment "Nvidia Is Preparing the “Most Amazing Thing” Ever Made", here in this thread that I posted.
[url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=16801']https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=16801[/url]
Also in attendance at the nVidia event were industry heavyweight Devs John Carmack from id Software, Tim Sweeney from Epic Games and Johan Andersson from Dice. They spoke about their high excitement and the benefits about this new technology during the presentation, and following it had a panel discussion speaking further not only about G-Sync but other interesting gaming industry technologies, topics and trends.
[url='https://www.pcper.com/news/Graphics-Cards/John-Carmack-Tim-Sweeney-and-Johan-Andersson-Talk-NVIDIA-G-Sync-AMD-Mantle-and-G']https://www.pcper.com/news/Graphics-Cards/John-Carmack-Tim-Sweeney-and-Johan-Andersson-Talk-NVIDIA-G-Sync-AMD-Mantle-and-G[/url]

item.title: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Probably won’t upgrade my monitor until 2560x1440 or higher resolution (preferably 3840x2160) 27" - 30" OLED monitors are a thing

“Infinite” contrast ratio
<1ms response time
Potential for >1000Hz refresh rate (combine with G-Sync or similar tech for :awesome: ). Interface/cables will probably be the limiting factor.
Almost 180° viewing angle
Wide colour gamut

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
the age of proprietary software is slowly coming to an end

give it another 20-30 years and proprietary hardware will be out of phase thanks to cheap and advanced 3D printing
maybe

Wouldnt that be cool, if you could actually design and create your own hardware, easily? When we get to that point, we’ll be truly open source.

Read full topic

item.source: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming

item.title: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
No one’s gonna stop making cheap monitors. It would be ridiculous to exclude a huge part of your market in favor of making just expensive items. Also, in theory FreeSync shouldn’t cost you anything extra. However the fact that no one has worked on it yet seems to indicate that they didn’t know what to do with such a technology, and now that G-Sync is around, they may take a cue from Nvidia and figure out a way to charge for it. In any case, at least there’s a competing technology in the works, so all around prices ought to fall after a while.

Read full topic
item.source: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming

item.title: NVIDIA's G-Sync Attempts To Revolutionize Gaming
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Well, according to the accounts of people who’ve seen it in person it’s pretty amazing. It kills two birds with one stone and looks pretty damn smooth and sharp.

Basically imagine that you can play any game with a framerate over 30 super smooth and lag free with absolutely no screen tear and judder because of framerate fluctuation. Graphics stay smooth and sharp at all times no matter how unorthodox and variable your framerate is.

Read full topic
